results.title: Meeting in progress
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Tony Matthews and Ian Woolf
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Interaction”.
Part 8 of a series of films for managers. Demonstrates two exercises designed to improve managers’ listening and interactive skills. Viewers can participate in the second exercise which involves attempting to follow a set of instructions and shows the problems of communication without feedback. Introduced by Brian Redhead.

results.title: Meet your Federal Government
results.brief_description: This film gives a detailed description of how the US Federal Government operates and a brief description of the meaning of such government to the citizens of the United Sates. Discusses the purpose and function of the three main branches of government; the Capitol or legislative branch; the White House or executive branch and the Supreme Court or judicial branch. Discusses the system of checks and balances which exists between these branches of government.

results.title: Meet Tisani
results.brief_description: Tsani, a Thai public health nurse, brings health care to families living along the canals in and around Bangkok. Her story illustrates the new role women are placing in solving basic publics health problems and in speeding Thai national development.

results.title: Meet the Ship
results.brief_description: A Petty Officer introduces a recruit to a cruiser of the Royal Navy. As they walk around the ship the Officer, an old salt, gives the recruit an impression of life at sea in peace and war. The structure, equipment and armament of the vessel are examined in detail and there is incidental information on some naval traditions.

results.title: Meet the People
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Blurring the line between documentary and fiction, truth and artifice, Meet the People presents fourteen ‘characters’ who face the camera in talking head close-ups and speak about their lives and dreams. The intimacy and honesty of their fragmented, autobiographical storytelling is illusory; the credits reveal that these people are professional actors, playing fictional roles, reading a script. As Silver writes, this work points to a complicity on the part of the viewer in his desire to believe and identify with the traditions of and characters on TV. The same television that mimics a perfected form of the identity of the ‘average person’ is also in part responsible for creating this identity; it both researches, uses and manufactures this ‘average person’s‘ hopes and dreams. And so the question of a ‘real person’ becomes ‘real’ compared to what?

results.title: Meet the parents [DVD]
results.creator_credit: NBCUniversal, Universal Pictures, Nancy Tenenbaum, Jane Rosenthal, Robert De Niro and Jay Roach
results.brief_description: Nurse Greg Focker (Ben Stiller) is prepared to propose to his girlfriend Pam (Teri Polo), but first must ask her father Jack (Robert De Niro) for his blessing. The perfect opportunity to do so occurs when Greg and Pam visit her family for her sisters wedding. Unfortunately, Jack is still trying to re-unite his daughter with her blue-blood ex-boyfriend Kevin (Owen Wilson) and Greg must prove himself a more worthy candidate for his daughter’s love. A series of unfortunate incidents and misunderstandings including flooding the backyard, setting fire to the house and losing the cat cause Greg to be rejected by Pam’s entire family, in particular her overprotective father, and Greg has to fight to gain their approval and convince them of his love for Pam. Also starring Blythe Danner, Jon Abrahams and James Rebhorn.

results.title: Meet the Midland
results.creator_credit: Greenpark Productions, Midlands Bank, Humphrey Swingler and Daniel Ingram
results.brief_description: An account of everyday business conducted by one of Britain’s leading banks. Activities are illustrated through a series of stories woven around different clients and their problems. In this way, sequences describe many of the facilities offered by the bank - including general cheque clearing services; deposit and loan accounts for individuals and business houses, and specialised assistance given by the overseas trade promotion department.

results.title: Meet the mayor
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Look at Life”.
Gives an account of the duties of a mayor and records some colourful civic ceremonies. Mayors have been an integral part of British national and civic life for generations. Today there are 430 mayors in Britain, each elected by citizens to serve their community.

group_siblings.title: Look at life: Bronze silver and gold

results.title: Meet the feebles
results.creator_credit: Wingnut Films, Jim Booth and Peter Jackson
results.brief_description: Director Peter Jackson’s ‘spluppet creature feature’ began as a television short before being developed into a feature film. ‘Meet the Feebles’ is a rude, adult comedy about the backstage goings-on amongst a group of puppets. Heidi the Hippo, the star of the show has an eating disorder and discovers her producer husband, a walrus named Bletch, is having an affair, causing chaos to break out the day before their televised variety special. Harry, the host of the show is a sex crazed rabbit, develops an illness the doctor describes as ‘the big one’, is given only hours to live, and must hide from a fly, a press reporter looking for a sensational story. Robert the hedgehog has fallen head over heels in love with Lucille the poodle and is stunned when he catches her having sex with Trevor the rat, the show’s stage manager who makes porn films in his spare time. Other cast members include an elephant trying to avoid a paternity suit filed against him by a chicken, a Vietnam Vet frog with a drug problem and the director of the show, a frustrated fox named Sebastian who would rather be on the other side of the camera. Heidi, after being rejected by her husband for a much younger and much thinner cat, goes on a shooting spree during the telecast, killing almost all of the cast. Other film highlights include drug deals on a golf course, lovestruck Robert getting advice from an aged turtle and the show’s contortionist finding himself in fix. The film’s dark sense of humour is supported by gross-out effects and an incredibly catchy theme song. With a cast of over 90 puppets, ‘Meet the Feebles’ was considered to be the first creature film for adults and includes parodies of ‘The Godfather’ and ‘The Deer Hunter’.

results.title: Meet the chief
results.creator_credit: Swift Films, Boy Scouts Association (Great Britain) and Peter Hadingham
results.brief_description: The Chief Scout, Sir Charles MacLean, in his home on the Isle of Mull. He is shown entertaining three Scouts and showing them over the castle where his ancestors have lived for centuries. The 1960 march past of Queen’s Scouts before Her Majesty at Windsor Castle; the Chief Scout’s speech on that occasion. Finally, a message from him to the Scouts of the Commonwealth.
